decision_conditions: It is recommended that these two sycamore trees, which are subject to this application and are situated to the front right hand and left hand side on the curtilage of  5 Gidea Close, this is within the Gidea Park Conservation Area.

The Sycamore tree on the right hand side which is showing signs of decay in a number of the pollarded stems, to carry out aerial inspection and if the integrity of the tree is safe, re-pollard to previous pruning points, if excessive decay is found fell Sycamore.
The Sycamore tree on  left hand side can be pollard to previous pruning points to maximum of 30%

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
The applicant is advised that if you wish to carry out further works to the above tree[s] you will need to obtain our further consent.

You should comply with British Standard No. 3998 'Recommendations for Tree Work' a copy of which can be inspected at this office. You are advised that the work should be undertaken by a competent and suitably qualified tree contractor.
description:
Two sycamore trees.
The sycamore tree furthest away from the pavement at Gidea Close, is considerably rotten and we have had large branches which are dead fallen on to our cars. My preference would be to pollard it but if the tree surgeon thinks it is not viable to save, then you have agreed to cut it down.
The sycamore tree nearest the pavement at Gidea Close you have agreed to pollard it back to where it was previously done or 30%.
